channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 自 2010 年起，彼得-蒂尔开始资助学生辍学创办公司或非营利组织。他的提议比以往任何时候都更受欢迎。
item.description:
Since 2010, Peter Thiel has offered to pay students to drop out of school to start companies or nonprofits. His offer is more popular than ever. https://t.co/HZIVWnR7PV https://t.co/HZIVWnR7PV

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 24, 2024

item.title: 一位精神科医生下载了一款赌博应用程序，以便在晚上放松心情。赌博公司让她不断下注，直到她输掉 40 多万美元。"你就是无法自拔"
item.description:
A psychiatrist downloaded a gambling app to unwind at night. Gambling companies kept her betting until she lost more than $400,000. “You just can’t get out.” https://t.co/CXckEsVhJ9 https://t.co/CXckEsVhJ9

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 24, 2024

item.title: 一位研究生遇到了一个与他的年龄不相符的问题：他担心自己存钱太多，花钱太少。一位财务顾问给出了自己的看法。
item.description:
A grad student has an unusual problem for his age: He worries he may be saving too much and spending too little. A financial adviser weighs in. https://t.co/IgDoNWuujb https://t.co/IgDoNWuujb

item.title: 瘦下来的工人说，健身有助于他们的事业。大多数人把他们新发现的成功归功于人们对他们的好感。"这确实改变了人们对你的看法"。
item.description:
Slimmed-down workers say that getting in shape has helped their careers. Most attribute their newfound success to being viewed more favorably. “It does change people’s view of you.” https://t.co/idF5Uck52Z pic.twitter.com/dcBMOey4U6

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 24, 2024

item.title: @yarotrof写道：俄罗斯入侵乌克兰两年后，全世界都在关注美国是否继续致力于欧洲安全。

item.title: 目前还没有预防痴呆症的万无一失的方法，但研究人员正在进一步了解主要由我们控制的因素与认知能力下降之间的联系
item.description:
There’s no surefire way to prevent dementia, but researchers are learning more about links between factors largely within our control and cognitive decline https://t.co/M71mIofBpb https://t.co/M71mIofBpb

item.title: 过去十年间，三星电子的李在镕曾两次身陷囹圄，共度过了大约 560 天。现在他已经摆脱了法律纠纷，这位电子巨头的下一步会是什么？
item.description:

item.title: 12 年前，兰德尔-阿特金斯花了大约 200 万美元买下了一座老煤矿。他本以为这只是勉强盈利。然而，他却发现这可能会带来一笔意外之财。
item.description:
Twelve years ago, Randall Atkins bought an old coal mine for about $2 million. He thought it might just eke out a profit. Instead, he learned it could bring a windfall. https://t.co/RowiDaQKga https://t.co/RowiDaQKga

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 24, 2024
